attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen to keep schools open and there are those who have said they want to build a herd immunity, including The PM himself...yet for some reason it is seen as a bad enough reason to suspend the democratic process in this country and suspend local elections for a full year. This defies logic and Parliament should reinstate local elections
attributes.background: The government is allowing schools to stay open despite the Covid-19 virus, Parliament is still sitting, football is only off for a few weeks, but it is considered bad enough to suspend the democratic process, even if suspension is required, why a full year?

rejection.details:
We've rejected this petition as it is now out of date, since schools are being closed.

You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302247

You could start a new petition calling for elections to take place as planned but without comparing it to things that have now been cancelled or closed.
